revised_title: Meteorological Observations and Phenomena in Caen, Normandy (1765-1769)
tldr: This article presents meteorological observations and phenomena recorded in Caen, Normandy, from 1765 to 1769. The author, Nathanael Pigott, documents daily barometer readings, wind patterns, temperature fluctuations, and notable weather events such as storms, frosts, and the fall of a mysterious fireball. These observations provide a detailed snapshot of the local climate and weather patterns during this period.
